image.altText: South Australian Liberal MP Ashton Hurn outside parliament.

props.synopsis: South Australian Liberal MP Ashton Hurn has secured her party's leadership months out from the next state election.

title.children: Ashton Hurn confirmed as new SA Liberal leader

image.altText: Green lilypads and grasses line the edge of the River Murray.

props.synopsis: Water needs for river communities will be under increasing pressure over the next 25 years, according to predictions from the Murray-Darling Basin Authority.

title.children: Grim outlook for river spanning four states if nothing is done to combat climate's impact

image.altText: A sign reading Yatala Labour Prison behind blurred greenery

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old prisoner was so badly bashed at an Adelaide jail on Sunday morning that he was left "barely recognisable" and had to be rushed to hospital for treatment, a union says.

title.children: Prisoner 'barely recognisable' after alleged assault at SA jail, union says

image.altText: An oval sign under a shop verandah saying sacat.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government is trying to speed up the transfer of hospital patients into aged care, but advocates say they are "trampling on the rights of older people" in the process.

title.children: Exploitation fears over SA government aged care changes

image.altText: A group of young people toast over a meal holding glasses of limoncello.

props.synopsis: South Australian distillers are tapping into a growing global thirst for limoncello and finding a new market for lemons and grape spirit.

title.children: The sweet spirit 'steeped in tradition' that's becoming trendy

image.altText: A close up historic shot of a man wearing aviator sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Bevan Spencer von Einem — who police have linked to "The Family" — has died while serving a life sentence for the sexually motivated abduction and murder of Richard Kelvin in 1983.

title.children: Notorious murderer Bevan von Einem dies while serving life sentence

image.altText: A wine industry expert stands amid vines.

props.synopsis: Among the main factors contributing to women leaving Australia's wine industry were sexism, discrimination, and a lack of flexibility, a nationwide study has found.

title.children: Sexism, harassment and inflexibility drive women out of winemaking

image.altText: Laneway before a single storey building

props.synopsis: Residents of Gilbert Street who originally opposed a development proposal say a deal was struck behind closed doors to proceed with planning.

title.children: Adelaide residents 'in the dark' over Gilbert Street development proposal

image.altText: A man in a dark dry suit floating with his head above water in a pool, in scuba diving gear.

props.synopsis: Open water divers say underwater visibility has improved and marine life is returning to some areas off South Australia's coast. Experts say it's a positive sign, but warn it's "way too early" to say the environment is recovering from the state's algal bloom.

title.children: Fish returning to some parts of SA's coast, divers say

image.altText: Three young girls, with the middle one carrying a toddler.

props.synopsis: The stark beauty of Australia's protected APY Lands is alive with ancient songlines and culture. But Elders see a need for change to secure the future of today's children.

title.children: Rare look at family, country and culture on the beautiful APY Lands

image.altText: Queen Elizabeth Hospital new clinical services building.

props.synopsis: A 36-year-old who prompted a manhunt after allegedly escaping custody at Adelaide's Queen Elizabeth Hospital on Thursday night has been re-arrested and will face court on Monday, police say.

title.children: Alleged Adelaide hospital escapee re-arrested after manhunt, police say

image.altText: A picture of an English teenage cricket fan smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Tommy Lamb is taking the long way from Manchester to Adelaide for the third Ashes Test and the 18-year is closing in on a 100-day odyssey that must be seen to be believed.

title.children: The 100 days, 21 countries and one fractured skull behind one Pom's wild Ashes tour

image.altText: Sixers players celebrate after winning a WBBL match

props.synopsis: Ellyse Perry produced one of the best knocks of her career but the Sydney Sixers took until the final ball to see off the Adelaide Strikers and land a WBBL finals spot.

title.children: Sixers down Strikers in final-ball thriller to secure WBBL finals berth

image.altText: Lando Norris holds up his fist

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen has won the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix ahead of Oscar Piastri, but Lando Norris finishes third to claim the world title.

title.children: Lando Norris claims F1 world title after dramatic Abu Dhabi Grand Prix

image.altText: Glenrock Parade destruction Koolewong 071225

props.synopsis: Natural disasters are declared in six areas across NSW, as the number of homes destroyed rises to at least 20, with the majority concentrated on the Central Coast.

title.children: 20 homes now confirmed lost in NSW bushfires

image.altText: several volunteers who joined the russian armed forces line up ready to board a plane

props.synopsis: Through a targeted social media campaign, Russia is offering citizenship and money to foreigners who join its fight in Ukraine, but experts say it is a desperate measure.

title.children: Foreigners recruited by Russia end up in 'Moscow meat grinder'

image.altText: A professional woman speaks in front of an EU flag backdrop.

props.synopsis: The European Union says it will learn from Australia's new laws to bar under-16s from social media, with steps to implement the world-first ban already underway and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen praising Australia's "brave move".

title.children: The EU has voted in favour of a teen social media ban, but not like Australia's

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaking.

props.synopsis: The furore over Communications Minister Anika Wells's expenses continues, with just three days until the government's much-anticipated social media ban for under 16s comes into force.

title.children: PM's office approved almost $100k in flights for communications minister

image.altText: A group of young women gathered in a backyard with drinks in their hands.

props.synopsis: We asked two experts for their advice on the etiquette of leaving a social gathering without notice and the best approaches to take if you do need to depart suddenly.

title.children: Is it ever OK to leave a party or social event without saying goodbye?

image.altText: A close up of Taylor Swift on stage, wearing a bejewelled leotard.

props.synopsis: From the world's first traffic lights to a Sesame Street legend — how well will you do on our history quiz?

title.children: Quiz: From Taylor Swift to the South Pole, can you best our history test?

image.altText: A woman, her face obsucred, looks at a framed photograph of women and children in the desert

props.synopsis: In the 1960s, the last of the desert families were coming into contact with white people. For one woman, the moment was captured on camera.

title.children: This rare photo captures the 'first contact' between desert families and white Australia

image.altText: China's first aircraft carrier, the Liaoning, sails into Hong Kong for a port call

props.synopsis: Japan formally protests the incident, calling it "an extremely regrettable" and dangerous act that "exceeded the scope necessary for safe aircraft operations".

title.children: Japan and Australia urge calm after Chinese radar locks onto Japanese jets

image.altText: Trump furrows his brow as he enunciates a word, staring directly into a camera

props.synopsis: A Republican claimed a win at a by-election in Tennessee this week, but his party colleagues are sounding alarm bells.

title.children: This Tennessee election has set off alarm among Trump's Republicans

image.altText: Ben Stokes looks upwards after a loss

props.synopsis: England's famed captain-coach duo aren't going to let their relationship fray in the face of the biggest test of their polarising tenure.

title.children: As Stokes questions England's toughness, McCullum warns of 'glass jaw'

image.altText: Two people wearing black t-shirts stand next to a glass cabinet with smears of food on it

props.synopsis: An organisation called Take Back Power, which describes itself as a civil resistance group, posted footage of the incident on social media and said two of its members had smothered the Imperial State Crown display case with apple crumble and custard.

title.children: Four arrested in London after apple crumble thrown at Crown Jewels display

image.altText: The charred interiors of a nightclub, with grey floors and walls.

props.synopsis: Local village council official Roshan Redkar tells a news agency that authorities had earlier issued a demolition notice for the club as it had no construction permit from the government, but higher officials rolled back the order.

title.children: Nightclub fire kills at least 25 in India's Goa state

image.altText: Two people dressed in blue protective gear carrying out a stretcher with a body on it covered in a white sheet.

props.synopsis: Gunmen stormed a hostel in the early hours of the morning, shooting 25 people at the scene and killing at least 11 people, including three children.

title.children: At least 11 killed in South Africa hostel shooting

image.altText: Rasmus Neergaard-Petersen of Denmark poses with the Stonehaven Cup after winning Australian Open.

props.synopsis: A missed putt costs Cameron Smith the chance of winning his first Australian Open, as Denmark's Rasmus Neergaard-Petersen claimed a thrilling one-stroke victory at Royal Melbourne.

title.children: Smith denied first Australian Open title as Dane claims tense win

image.altText: Thailand’s Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul

props.synopsis: Accused of incompetence and apathy in the aftermath of natural disasters, governments across Asia are facing increasing backlash as the impact of global warming intensifies.

title.children: A new storm is brewing in South-East Asia. This time it's in the halls of power

image.altText: A female's hands operate a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Australia's social media age ban is one of the most significant attempts to rebalance the asymmetric power relationship between government and tech.

title.children: Parents could grant Labor the grace the opposition won't on social media ban

image.altText: A display monitor on the handlebars of an e-bike

props.synopsis: An e-bike will be top of their Christmas wish list this year, prompting a warning for parents to know the rules.

title.children: A Christmas warning for parents thinking of buying an e-bike

image.altText: A burnt out car, with destroyed and damaged buildings visible behind it

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin this week claimed Moscow's biggest battlefield gain in close to two years: the Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk. Some experts don't believe him.

title.children: Why the small city of Pokrovsk means so much to Vladimir Putin

image.altText: Pro-choice protesters dressed as handmaidens outside the US Capitol

props.synopsis: In the wake of widespread abortion bans, US prosecutors launch hundreds of cases charging people with crimes related to their pregnancy, miscarriage, stillbirth or birth.

title.children: 'This was a wanted pregnancy': The mothers facing prosecution in Trump's America
